item.title: Ed Sheeran - Shape of You - Key of Am
item.description:
For educational use.
Chords: Am Dm F G
Shape of You by Ed Sheeran. Itâ€™s been lowered by 4 semitones to beginner ukulele students can play along.
If you found this video useful please subscribe and share with your friends. If you want to be notified of future videos please click on bell next to subscribe.
Do you have a request for a song to be made into a video? First, check the index of play alongs at www.ukeplayalongs.com to make sure your song isn't already available. If it isn't, please fill out this request form: https://forms.gle/84rgm7kFNJWnTqFB6 . We cannot promise that a request will be made into a play along, but we do appreciate your recommendations! Original / Official Video Here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JGwWNGJdvx8

item.title: Ed Sheeran - Hands of Gold
item.description: Friends! This video is dedicated to the premiere season 8 of the Game of Thrones. During a trip to the Riverlands, Arya stumbles upon the Lanister soldiers who perform this song. In the A Song of Ice and Fire, the authorship of this song is attributed to the bard Simon Silver Tongue. In it is sung about the secret romance of Tyrion and Shae. The role of one of the soldiers acting by Ed Sheeran, it was a kind of surprise for Messi Williams, as she is a fan of Sheeran's work. ðŸ”´ https://vk.com/aboutukulele ðŸ’° https://www.patreon.com/AboutUkulele ðŸ’° http://www.donationalerts.ru/r/about_ukulele #ukulele #GameOfThrones #EdSheeran

item.title: Ed Sheeran - What Do I Know? - Key of G
item.description:
This tutorial will show you how to play What Do I Know on the ukulele by Ed Sheeran. The chords used are G C D Em Bm. (Original in E)
If you found this video useful please subscribe and share with your friends. If you want to be notified of future videos please click on bell next to subscribe.
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The uke chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com.

item.title: Ed Sheeran - Castle on the Hill - Key of D
Ed Sheeran - The A Team - Key of A
item.description:
Ukulele play along
The A Team - Ed Sheeran
Using the chords: A Bm7 D E F#m (I have simplified the chord progressions in a few places)
Suggested Strum Patterns: D DU U DU works but it is worth try a few.
This video is meant for educational purposes.
No copyright infringement intended

item.title: Ed Sheeran - Perfect - Key of G
Ed Sheeran - Photograph - Key of F
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of F. Original key is E, so raised a half step for ukulele friendliness.
As performed by Ed Sheeran.
Iâ€™ll be honest...this one was tricky. In looking up the chords, a lot of sites have this in D. That is great...because with a four chord song, I can drop it a whole step and make it beginner friendly with C, Am, F, and G...the â€œColor Chords (see Kalaâ€™s new ukulele).â€ Well, I lowered the pitch and things werenâ€™t right...the intro tab had sharps (in C?) and I quickly realized that several sites had ALREADY lowered the pitch for ukulele. The song was originally in E. Why E? It is a great, rich key on the guitar (lots of open strings) and some voices (like Sheeranâ€™s) fit well in the key. So...I could have gone with D (D, Bm, G, A) or F...but D is a whole step transition, so I went UP the half step to F (F, Dm, Bb, C). I think thatâ€™s the right choice, unless you want to play in Sheeranâ€™s original key playing in D (with a Bm barre chord) and using a capo on the 2nd Fret.
Need to practice at a different tempo? Use the gear icon in the video (lower right) to slow down (or speed up) the tempo at pitch! Need to do so on an iPad or iPhone? Check out the browser called "iCab Mobile" which has a Module called "Video Playback Rate"
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com.
Are these ukulele resources valuable to you? If so, consider following my blog at ukestuff.info, and becoming a patron at www.patreon.com/cjrphd. There is a master list of all similar play along videos at ukestuff.info.
